p: Socio-economic impacts include reduced visibility which tends to affect both airports and their transport services, such as air traffic control and communication disturbance, including the closing of airports in extreme dust conditions ( Dorta, 2007). However, the impacts on human health are amongst the most relevant, since respiratory pathologies, anxiety disorders, and atypical thoracic pain usually affect local population ( Garc√≠a Carrasco et al., 2001). Other studies have reported respiratory allergic diseases leading to increased use of air liquid as a respiratory therapy as much as 600% ( Belmonte et al., 2010). It has also been suggested that Saharan dust events might be related to the introduction of microbial communities, such as bacteria and viruses ( Gonzalez-Martin et al., 2013).
